Class RenderPass

java.lang.Object
Kartoffel.Licht.Vulkan.RenderPass
All Implemented Interfaces:
AutoCloseable, VulkanFreeable, VulkanObject
public class RenderPass extends Object implements VulkanFreeable, VulkanObject
Draw commands must be recorded within a render pass instance. Each render pass instance defines a set of image resources, referred to as attachments, used during rendering.

In Vulkan, a RenderPass is divided up into multiple RenderPass.subpasses. Subpasses can each operate only on their own pixel, eg. it could be used for deferred rendering, but not for effects like bloom.
Each subpass has a list of RenderPass.subpass.References for color attachments, and one reference for depth/stencil. Those mainly contain an index to an attachment.
See Also:
  • Render Pass :: Vulkan Documentation Project

  • Nested Class Summary

    Nested Classes
    Modifier and Type
    Class
    Description
    static class 
    RenderPass.renderAttachment
    An attachment description describes the properties of an attachment including its format, sample count, and how its contents are treated at the beginning and end of each render pass instance.
    static class 
    RenderPass.subpass
    A subpass represents a phase of rendering that reads and writes a subset of the attachments in a render pass.
